node.title: Lucy and Daniel were planning a Tasmanian holiday — then they tried to hire a car
node.alt: A man and woman wearing a cap and collared shirt smile with a national park in the background.
node.description: Tasmanian tourism operators are desperate for a post-COVID visitor boom but there are fears a shortage of hire cars will drive them away.
node.content:
["As Tasmania prepares\u00a0to reopen to the rest of the country next week, interstate travellers who have been locked out for months are planning long-awaited\u00a0holidays across Bass Strait.\u00a0", "Sydney couple Daniel Gocher and Lucy Manne\u00a0began planning their camping trip as soon as they could.\u00a0", "\"We were flying into Launceston and had planned to travel around for a couple of weeks,\" Daniel Gocher said.", "\"We were heading to the Tarkine and then across to the Bay of Fires, so we were looking to hire a car with a bit of space.\"", "That's\u00a0when they hit an unexpected hurdle.", "\"We went on a car hire aggregator site and they were going to charge us somewhere between $2,500 and $3,500 for two weeks, which is certainly beyond what we'd budgeted for.\"", "They aren't alone.", "", "
The couple had planned to head to the Bay of Fires on Tasmania's east coast.\u00a0(Supplied: Zilla Gordon)
", "
Car shortage worsened by COVID
", "Julie Poumes runs a travel agency in Melbourne's eastern suburbs.", "She says Tasmania is top of the travel list for many of her clients, but car hire is a sticking point.", "\"People just go,\u00a0'No I'm not paying that', and that's when they look at later dates, or they look at another destination.\"", "Expensive car hire in Tasmania isn't new, but the pandemic has made the situation far worse.", "\"When COVID first hit, a lot of those big national companies got rid of half of their fleet literally to survive\u00a0and they haven't put them back on in the same numbers,\" Vince Powell from Tassie Car Rentals said.", "\"In a normal scenario those big companies might've put on 1,000 extra cars over Christmas, but that isn't happening.", "\"So you've got a lot less cars, a lot more people: supply and demand.\"", "Mr Powell's company offers second-hand rentals which are cheaper than the big brands.", "", "
Many places in Tasmania, like the Southwest National Park, require a car to get there.(Supplied: Patrick Kelly\u00a0)
", "But his fleet has been entirely snapped up for the summer.", "\"We've been booked out for a long time for Christmas, all of January, half of February,\" he said.", "
Car shortages a headache for tourism operators
", "There is always the option of bringing\u00a0your own car across from Melbourne on the Spirit of Tasmania ferry but tickets are scarce.\u00a0", "Thousands of people made bookings immediately after it was announced that borders would reopen on December 15, so finding a space in December and January won't be easy.", "It's creating a headache for Tasmania's $3 billion tourism industry, which supports around 15 per cent\u00a0of the state's jobs.", "Tourism operators are desperate for a post-opening jump in visitation and are worried the high cost of car rentals will see people go elsewhere.", "\"A lot of us have battled really hard and worked our way through it, but we are at the very edge,\" Bonorong Wildlife Sanctuary director Greg Irons said.", "", "
Lucy and Daniel had planned to visit the Tarkine region in Tasmania's north-west.\u00a0(Supplied: Dan Broun)
", "Bonorong is half an hour's drive north of Hobart\u00a0and without public transport options, is heavily reliant on self-drive traffic.", "\"Making it easier for people to visit destinations really should be up there in our very top priorities if we want to keep our businesses,\" Mr Irons said.\u00a0", "Tasmania's Tourism Minister Sarah Courtney said the government was keeping an eye on the situation.", "\"We are monitoring some of those price points, and the government is engaged with some of those businesses to make sure hire cars aren't an impediment to someone wanting to visit our state,\" she said.\u00a0", "
More cars needed to drive down prices
", "Hire\u00a0car companies are still nervous about the possibility of further border closures\u00a0and aren't rushing to replenish their fleets.", "", "
The director of Bonorong Wildlife Sanctuary, Greg Irons, says the park is dependent on self-drive visitation.\u00a0(ABC News: Rhiannon Shine)
", "\"As Australia reopens, we expect more significant fluctuations in market demand and customer rental patterns and are keeping our fleet at optimum levels to help meet this demand,\" a spokesperson for Budget Rent a Car said.", "The Department of State Growth has\u00a0tried to increase supply by offering $1,000 grants to offset the costs of Tasmanians hiring out their personal cars to tourists via car-sharing platforms like Evee and Car Next Door.", "From April to November, more than 260 applications were approved under the scheme, resulting in 678 newly registered hire and drive vehicles coming online.", "\"As the supply and availability of vehicles increases it is expected that this will put downward pressure on the cost of hiring a vehicle, as will general market forces,\" a spokesperson for the department said.", "But with the scheme due to end on Christmas Eve, car hire \u2014 and the prospect of a Tasmanian holiday \u2014\u00a0will remain unaffordable for many interstate tourists.", "", "
